artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Nozaki Bunzō; Publisher: Kakumotoya Kinjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 6; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 13 no. 11, p. 306.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unattached diptych; two heavily tattooed, seminude male figures; figure at L is scratching PL shoulder with PR hand, looking back; figure has small purse crossing his upper body; kerchief tied in bow over head; figure at R has blue spotted kerchief on hair, looking outward
dimension: 14 1/4 × 9 5/8 in. (36.2 × 24.45 cm) (image, sheet, each sheet; vertical ōban diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seal: 未十二改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Text by Kanagaki Robun. Right: actor Kawarazaki Gonjūrō I as Araiso no Gon荒磯の権. Left: actor Nakamura Fukusuke I as Kanjaku no Fuku翫雀の福. Artist signature is above the Yoshikiri seal and almost invisable.
title: Fashionable Men with Impressive Bare Bodies
